Jomišča Snaradaŭ zachoŭvaje bojeprypasy dla łuka i strelby
Sake varać z rysu. Mała što robić prostych ludziej i vajaroŭ takimi ščaslivymi, jak sake.
My fiermientujem sojevyja boby ŭ miso i sojevy sous. Usie lubiać soju!
Piaryła ci kitovy tłušč pierapracoŭvajecca ŭ presie ŭva adnarodnaje masła. Masła ŭžyvajecca dla lampavaha aśviatleńnia, dla myła i dla šmatlikich inšych metaŭ.
My apracoŭvajem draŭninu i rami dy vyrablajem vydatnyja łuki i streły.
My vyrablajem śviečki z kitovaha tłušču ci łaku.
My śpiecyjalizujemsia na stvareńni instrumantaŭ, jakija vykarystoŭvajucca ŭ inšych prafiesijach.
Zaścierahalnyja majsterni hrajuć najvažnuju rolu ŭ vajskovaj spravie, vyrablajuć zaścierahalny ryštunak dla vajaroŭ.
Zbrojnyja majsterni hrajuć najvažnuju rolu ŭ vajskovaj spravie, vyrablajuć zbroju blizkaha boju dla vajaroŭ.
Złotniki pieratvarajuć šlachietnyja mietały ŭ kaštoŭnaści. Kaštoŭnaści zjaŭlajucca lepšymi handlovymi tavarami.
My pieratvarajem syravinnyja vałokny rami ŭva prydatnuju dla vykarystańnia tkaninu.
My pieratvarajem syravinnyja bavoŭnavyja vałokny ŭ prydatnuju vopratku.
My pieratvarajem syravinny šoŭk u prydatny dla vykarystańnia materyjał dziela stvareńnia najvytančanaha adzieńnia.
My stvarajem strelby Tanehasima, vykarystoŭvajučy žaleza, draŭninu i sieru.

One adzin z daminantnych kłanaŭ Kiusiu. Atamo pretenduje na placoŭki ŭzhorystaha ŭschodniaha boku vyspy. Kvitniejučyja partovyja harady uźbiarežža pašyryli Chryścijanstva i handal na ziemlach Atamo. Dziakujučy hetaj supracy z Jeŭropaj, kłan Atamo zdabyŭ vierch u Japonskaj honcy technałahičnaha uzbrajeńnia i ŭmacavaŭ svaje šerahi impartnaj knotavaj zbrojaj. Atamo maje ziemli, što praścirajucca ad Bunho na poŭdni da Chakaty na poŭnačy. Panstva Atamo nie pazbaŭlena razładu. Kłan Mory rušyć z Chonsiu, i ŭžo zachapiŭ zamak Modzi dy pahražaje Atamo strataj kantrolu nad žyćciova važnym partovym horadam Chakata. Z ciapierašnim płacdarmam Mory na Kiusiu i ŭzrostam ułady Riudziodzi na zachadzie, Atamo musić zjadnacca pad čałom dajmio kłanu Atamo Soryn albo ryzyknuć stracić svaje žyćciova važnyja ziemli i party.
Jamakuhury-siu — najmickaja kampanija hornych žracoŭ, što pachodzić z hary Kinpo. Jany dziejničajuć jak sinobi, vyviedvajuć i špiehujuć za vorahami, dy ŭjaŭlajuć bajazdolnuju siłu.
Siŭaku-siu — najmickaja kampanija, što składajecca hałoŭnym čynam z transpartavych sudnaŭ. Jana słužyć šmatlikim kłanam, vykonvajuć łahistyčnyja zadańni, ale nia słaviacca vajskovym majsterstvam.
Tanho-Kaidzoku — pirackaja najmickaja kampanija, što bazujecca ŭ pravincyi Tanho. Heta adna z najbujnych pirackich frakcyjaŭ, što maje fłot z sotniaŭ karabloŭ. Ichniaja kolkaść vyklikaje strach.

Saika-siu — najmickaja kampanija, što składajecca z vajaroŭ tepo i dzidzamurajaŭ. Jany chutka asvoili knotavuju zbroju i daviali jaje efiektyŭnaść. Zaraz jany viadomy svajoj trapnaściu i śmiarotnaj zbrojaj.

Chakusan-siuto — najmickaja kampanija manachaŭ-vajaroŭ. Jana ciesna supracoŭničaje z kłanam Asakura i šmat u čym abaviazana jamu svajoj siłaj. Jany pachodziać z chrama Chakusan Cheisendzi i zjaŭlajucca hroznaj hrupaj vajaroŭ.

Kacurajama-siu — najmickaja kampanija, što składajecca z byłych samurajaŭ, što stali manachami. Ich baza mieścicca ŭ horach Tohakusi i Idzuna. Jany słynnyja svaimi viedami hornaj miascovaści i majsterstvam vałodańnia ahniapalnaj zbrojaj.
Suruha-siu — najmickaja kampanija, što śpiecyjalizujecca na marskich bitvach. Jany viadomyja svajoj łahistyčnaj padtrymkaj u ​​paŭdniovym krai Ciubu.
Kadzama-siu — najmickaja kampanija, što śpiecyjalizujecca na špijanažy i vyviedcy. Jany majuć błahuju reputacyju z-za rabavańniaŭ i zładziejstva, ale efiektyŭnyja ŭ bai.
Kurochabaki-siu — najmickaja kampanija, što śpiecyjalizujecca na špijanažy i sabatažy. Jany słynnyja svajoj nietradycyjnaj padryŭnoj taktykaj.

Saikaido, što pierakładajecca jak Zachodnie-Marski Łancuh, — samy zachodni kraj Japonii, razam z vyspaj Kiusiu. Udalečyni ad staličnaha zmahańnia za siohunackuju ŭładu i bližej da macierykovaj Azii, hety kraj pieratvaryŭsia ŭ marski i handlovy centar, kudy tavary i novyja idei pryvoziać Kitajskija i Karejskija handlary, a apošnim časam — pryjezdžyja zamiežniki-nanbany. Chacia Saikaj maje daŭnija tradycyi marskoha handlu ź inšymi krainami, jon nie čužy i vojnam: dajmio zmahajucca za kantrol nad vyspami, a proćma pirataŭ rabuje prybytkovyja handlovyja šlachi.

Rod Sajkaj pachodzić z najzachodniaj častki Japonii, jakaja achoplivaje vyspu Kiusiu, što znachodzicca bližej da macierykovaj častki Azii za siohunackuju stalicu z jaje zmahańniem za ŭładu. Dziakujučy svajmu ŭnikalnamu stanovišču Sajkai stali daśviedčanymi marapłaŭcami i kupcami, što majuć daŭnija handlovyja suviazi z Kitajem i Karejaj, a apošnim časam i z niadaŭna prybyłymi zamiežnikami-nanbanami, toje palahčaje Sajkajam dostup da zachodniaj ahniapalnaj zbroi. Adnak nie ŭsie Sajkai ličać handal svaim pryzvańniem: mnohija piratničajuć u mory, rabujuć bahatyja handlovyja šlachi, u toj čas jak miascovyja fieadały zmahajucca za zachavańnie svajoj niezaležnaści ad usiakaj centralnaj ułady.

The Nankaj people dwell on the mountainous islands of Awaji and Shikoku. Despite being skilled seafarers, the Nankaj have developed a strong identity and deep attachment to their homeland which they cultivate with dedication and reverence yielding much more than the average harvest. On the other hand, Nankaj have grown isolated and suspicious of the denizens of the other regions, leading them to focus more on the defense of their hometowns and their people.

The Sanyo people are native to the westernmost region of Chonsiu, whose challenging and mountainous terrain has driven them towards the coast, making the Sanyo expert sailors who navigate the seas of Japan with ease and great agility. Thanks to their renowned maritime prowess, the Sanyo home region has turned into a major trade hub, with large port cities such as Onomichi flourishing and yielding large tax revenues.

The Kinki people reside in the central part of Chonsiu representing the cultural, economic, and political heart of Japan. The direct heirs of the potentates who once ruled over the entire country, the Kinki benefit from the power structures left behind by their forebears, making it easier for them to consolidate their control over the different regions of Japan. The poetic tradition that flourished around Kyoto contributes to a growing renown of victorious warlords who emulate the deeds of legendary heroes. Nevertheless, years of armed clashes and political scheming for power make it consistently difficult for the Kinki lords to put aside their differences and unite against a common enemy.

The Chokuryku people reside in the strategically vital mountain passes and fertile coastal plains of northern Chonsiu that have long been targeted by neighboring warlords to control their key position. Over time, the Chokuryku have developed exceptional skills in defending their territory, often bolstering their ranks with warrior monks thanks to their proximity to powerful Buddhist temples. However, the internal stability of the region is increasingly threatened by the rise of the Jōdo Shinshū Buddhist sect that is gaining popularity among the Chokuryku and the Ikko Iki rebels, whose fervor and uprisings challenge the traditional power structures.

The people of Tosan reside in a region characterized by rugged mountainous terrain, which almost completely cuts off the local communities from the rest of the country, who have long become self-sufficient in order to survive the harsh climate. The Tosan have mastered the adverse terrain they traverse with surprising ease to reach timber and mineral deposits, and have developed a subsistence economy around the villages in the fertile valleys that allows them to sustain minimal growth and some excellences such as the renowned horses of the Kiso Valley.

The Tokaj people hail from the fertile lowlands and coastlines of central-southern Chonsiu, which serves as the ideal boundary between west and east of the country. This has led the Tokaj to develop a highly rural society based around sprawling village communities, while urban centers are limited to relatively small settlements unable to compete with the thriving towns of the rest of Japan. Despite the seemingly idyllic setting, such a strategic position makes the region a target for ambitious neighbours, and the Tokaj have learnt the imperative of remaining united in arms in the face of external threats much longer than most normally would.

The people of Kanto, the spiritual homeland of the samurai class, live in a predominantly flat region that is perfect for extensive agriculture and the breeding of its renowned battle steeds, which yield abundant harvests and allow Kanto to field and maintain cavalry forces more easily. Imbued with the secular martial tradition in which they have their roots, the lords of Kanto can more easily raise large armies to face their enemies, but their great emphasis on military preparedness makes it more expensive to pay the wages of their soldiers.

The Oŭ people, native to the harsh, snow-covered lands of northern Chonsiu, have adapted to their frosty environment with remarkable resilience. Daśviedčany in traversing snowy terrain, the Oŭ navigate blizzards and icy conditions with ease, moving swiftly where others would struggle, and are accustomed to strict rationing when foraging is not possible, allowing them to endure longer in the snowy wastelands. However, the relentless winters take their toll, and their remote and rugged villages struggle to grow as rapidly as those in more temperate regions, limiting their expansion and development.

Our gold reserves are running low, and Im worried we may not be able to soon pay our men. You should consider building workshops or setting up trade caravans to increase income. If you have any spare equipment we can sell, that can help in the short run. We could also pillage for a profit, but thats not my favorite option.
Were running low on food. We need a large supply to effectively launch any kind of campaign. Make sure we stock up on supplies soon.

Im concerned for the morale of the men. Lately it has been quite tough for us, and Ive overheard talk of desertion. You should consider raising morale by acquiring more types of food, or through other means.
We could use some more horses for the men to ride while we travel. It is much faster than walking and will increase our speed considerably.
We cannot carry all our goods. You should buy more pack animals or lighten our load. It will make it difficult to travel effectively without doing so.
I have no concerns. All the armys needs are accounted for.
You have room for more companions. You should consider hiring more, as they could be helpful in accomplishing your goals.
You can assemble more parties from your companions. They could add more manpower to our cause.

No, I have no advice to offer at this time.
Your men pull you from the battlefield, forced to leave behind the valuable loot.
The scavengers pry through the remaining loot and leave you on the battlefield. You blend in well with the dead soldiers. You awaken after some time to a battlefield that has been picked clean.
